body: the same error, with the same observations as above, also happens on OS X with mono 4.4.2

Based on my research, this seems to be caused (at least partially) by the connection attempts timing out.

When a subchannel is created, it is given a gpr_backoff object that  determines the connection attempt deadline and the time for the next attempt (both are actually the same value, so the first attempt to connect is given a too short limit).  If SSL handshake doesn't finish on time, the connection is closed (by on_timeout event in handshake.c). This seems to explain the insecure/secure difference, because the SSL handshake takes several roundtrips and is much more likely to miss the deadline, especially when there are more connections created in parallel.

For the time being, the workaround is to set grpc.initial_reconnect_backoff_ms to a HIGHER value (the default is 1000). I tried setting it to 10000 (so the first connection attempt for each channel will have a timeout of 10s) and I stopped seeing most of the failures to connect (I can connect 100 channels in parallel without a problem).

IMPORTANT: the channel argument `grpc.initial_reconnect_backoff_ms` is of integer type and it's value needs to be an integer.

```
// WRONG:  sets string value to an integer argument
// VALUE WILL BE IGNORED!!!
new ChannelOption("grpc.initial_reconnect_backoff_ms", "10000")

// CORRECT
new ChannelOption("grpc.initial_reconnect_backoff_ms", 10000)
```

(I will file a separate issue for the channel arg being ignored, as the behavior is very confusing)
An actual fix for this will likely be resolving #8696

@jtattermusch Your solution appears to solve the majority of the errors (as I understand, this channel argument is relevant to the client side)
Under heavy load, encrypted connections start to fail after a while (over a minute) with the following `RpcException`:

> Status(StatusCode=Cancelled, Detail="{"created":"@1478759465.033000000","description":"RST_STREAM","file":"c:\jenkins\workspace\gRPC_build_artifacts\architecture\x86\language\csharp\platform\windows\vsprojects..\src\core\ext\transport\chttp2\transport\frame_rst_stream.c","file_line":107,"http2_error":8}")

Which means some connection got RST packets.
I found that many channel arguments are declared in `grpc_types.h`, with a little comment above each one of them, describing its purpose. Do you have some more detailed documentation for those arguments? It might solve other problems (like the RST packets)

@amitwaisel   let's leave this issue open until #8696  because currently our defaults are broken and one needs to set initial_reconnect_backoff_ms to work around it.

Also, would you mind filing the RST_STREAM problem as a separate issue? It looks like a different problem and should be investigated separately. Thanks!
